reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a bit of a dodgy start (staff tried to switch us from double to twin), hotel turned out to be really nice, with good clean rooms (all services worked really well - inc aircon) and were cleaned very efficiently each day of our stay. Staff were very friendly and helpful and didn't make a fuss.
reviews.title: Great location, clean rooms, good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best thing about the hotel is its location - not so much its immediate location (which is a little urban - except excellent carrefour!), but if you turn right out the door or cross B.Barbes and head into Montmartre, the place is full of great culture and excellent places to eat, drink and shop. The market further north up the BB is fanatastic and a great place to get a slice of Paris life. Heading up to Sacre Couer is also brill and you can come back down by more or less any route and find something interesting.
reviews.title: Acceptable hotel at a good price in a terrible neighborhood

reviews.text: We spent most of our time further south in the Marais and 1st to 4th arrondisements; found the best pot of chocolate in the world (carret - Places Des Vosges) and just loved all the boutiques and cafes where we encountered nothing but friendly faces and helpful attitudes. We walked almost everywhere - I have the blisters to prove it and when distance was too great, we followed others' advice and took the carnet of 10 option on metro tickets and found we could just about manage two days exploring on that.
reviews.title: A great hotel with fabulous staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rue des Rosiers? Best Falafel in the world.....possibly!
reviews.title: Smart, modern and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is not one of the top-of-the-class Best Western hotels, but somehow it meets the basic requirements set by the brand's quality standards. Small rooms, we had one of the largest and inside I did not even have enough space to properly open my suitcase..the bathroom was even smaller in comparison, so small that there was no space for the bathroom tissue holder besides the WC and they had to put it BEHIND! Apart from that furniture was good and the room was clean. Breakfast was more than good and respected Best Western standards of full continental buffet. Service varies a lot, according to which receptionist you deal with it. We argued with some of them, while we had a very good treatment from Alexandre, very available and kind guy. The position is good, not in the very heart of Paris, but 10 min away by tube (station was 2 min on foot from hotel's entrance). The very bad thing was the neighborhood. This hotel is on the eastern side of Montmartre hill and this turned out to be one of the roughest places in Paris. We were afraid to stay out until late, so we always dined pretty early, despite our habits. Apart from that it was a good stay, but I'd never come back here, the neighborhood is definitely to avoid.
reviews.title: Good all round hotel with excellent staff

reviews.text: I stayed here for 2 nights with my mum who is 60. We both thought it was a great little hotel for what we wanted. I wanted a hotel that was central, clean and would fit into my budget. I paid about £80 a night for this hotel and thought it was great value for money.
reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's situated in the Montmartre area of Paris which is to the North. It's about a 5-10min walk from the Sacre Cour and it's lovely surrounding streets where you can find amazing restaurants and bars.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel Staff Services @ very good Room Rate in Paris...

reviews.text: The hotel itself is situated near Rue Barbes which is quite a busy street. As some of the reviews before mine have stated... yes it's a very cosmopolitan area. Expect to see all nationalities going about their business; African, Asian, Eastern European. For those genteel folk who have never been out of their village this might come as a culture shock, but to anyone who's ever lived or stayed in any other major city in Europe, especially London, Birmingham, Manchester etc... it's no different to any of these. For my mum and me we didn't experience any advserse behaviour by anyone, people are just going about their daily business and aren't hassling tourists. I saw more people being hassled around all the major tourist attractions!
reviews.title: Gem in Little Africa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel room itself was on the small side, but most are in Paris. The room was clean with a nice modern bathroom. We were on the 5th floor and our window looked out onto the street, which was quite noisy, however at night we simply closed it and couldn't hear hardly a thing. The rooms all have aircon and TV's, complimentary coffee and tea, and water.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Well Placed For Sightseeing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was great, continental style but then I cant manage a full English every morning anyway. Fresh croissants, juice, toast, eggs, cold meats, yoghurts and muffins. There is a maid/waitress who bustles about in the breakfast room making sure everything is stocked up.
reviews.title: No complaints, friendly, clean, very comfortable and very quiet.
